qas.question: What type of hunting is most closely associated with the UK?
How do the English hunt foxes?
In England, what is hunted when "shooting" is called for?

answers.text: form of vermin control to protect livestock

qas.question: How is deer stalking with rifles carried out?

answers.text: on foot without hounds, using stealth

qas.question: What hunting is done on horseback with hounds?
Hunting horseback with hound is associated with whom?
In Victorian times a popular social activity was?
What is carried out on foot without hounds?
Hounds were used for what purpose?
What was deer stalking with rifles originally a form of?
What did deer stalking originally aim to protect?
In what time did deer stalking become popular?
What group did deer stalking become popular with?
What kind of activity was deer stalking considered for both riders and followers?

context: Unarmed <a0_0><a5_0>fox<a5_0/> hunting<a0_0/> <a1_0>on horseback with hounds<a1_0/> is the type of hunting most closely associated with the <a6_0>United Kingdom<a6_0/>; in fact, "hunting" without qualification implies fox hunting. What in other countries is called "hunting" is called "shooting" (<a2_0>birds<a2_0/>) or "stalking" (deer) in Britain. Originally a <a3_0>form of <b10_0>vermin control<b10_0/> to protect <b11_0>livestock<b11_0/><a3_0/>, <a7_0>fox hunting<a7_0/> became a popular social activity for <b13_0>newly wealthy upper classes<b13_0/> in <b12_0>Victorian<b12_0/> times and <b14_0>a traditional rural activity<b14_0/> for riders and foot followers alike. Similar to fox hunting in many ways is the chasing of hares with hounds. Pairs of Sight hounds (or long-dogs), such as greyhounds, may be used <a9_0>to pursue<a9_0/> a hare in coursing, where the greyhounds are marked as to their skill in coursing the hare (but are not intended to actually catch it), or the hare may be pursued with scent hounds such as beagles or harriers. Other sorts of foxhounds may also be used for hunting stags (deer) or mink. <a8_0>Deer stalking<a8_0/> with rifles is carried out <a4_0>on foot without hounds, using stealth<a4_0/>.
